title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.1 EVIDENCE FOR DECISION-MAKING

description.narrative: Output 4.1 Strengthened national capacity to generate and utilise robust evidence on child poverty and vulnerabilities, and public finance to reduce socio-economic disparities and improve access to basic services, whilst promoting social inclusion, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 4. By 2025 child sensitive evidence and analysis informs more effective and efficient planning, budgeting and implementation of programmes for reducing child deprivation, inequities and gender inequalities, especially for the most vulnerable and marginalised children and adolescents

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

sector.narrative: Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty
Data analysis, including situation analysis and update
PF4C: Engagement with budget processes to improve social sector budgets (sufficiency, efficiency, effectiveness, transparency, equity)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Technical assistance - Child poverty, Public Finance and Local Governance

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 4.1 Strengthened national capacity to generate and utilise robust evidence on child poverty and vulnerabilities, and publicfinance to reduce socio-economic disparities and improve access to basic services, whilst promoting social inclusion

description.narrative: UNICEF strengthened the capacity of the Ministry of Health to monitor off-budget expenditures. A Public Finance for Children booklet and budget briefs produced to sensitize decision makers and encourage increased allocations to social sectors were produced. A National Budget Dialogue aimed at improving synergies between social protection and public finance management was held. At least 10 additional child-focused indicators on early childhood development, water quality, and disability were incorporated in the 2021 DHS tools. The results of the 2020/2021 National Survey on Violence were released, including results from the module on violence against children (VAC). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/01/2022

title.narrative: National government measurement of child poverty using multidimensional measures (25-01-L3-01), Text

baseline.value: Score 3 (Measured but not routine) - There is a child poverty measurement supported by the government but is not routinely measured.

target.value: 2025:Score 4 (Measured Routinely) - There is a child poverty measurement supported by the government and is routinely monitored.

actual.value: 2021:There is multidimensional child poverty measurement supported by the government and it is measured every 3 years.
